item.title: Link Typing
item.description: After Dark uses link typing to indicate semantic relationships between documents. By default the alternate link type is used to highlight the presence of web feeds on the homepage and in taxonomy listings: <link href="https://domain.example/index.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="After Dark"> <link href="https://domain.example/categories/privacy/index.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="After Dark"> <link href="https://domain.example/tags/color/index.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="After Dark"> In addition to defaults After Dark recognizes the prev and next link types if specified in page Front Matter:
item.content:encoded: After Dark uses link typing to indicate semantic relationships between documents. By default the alternate link type is used to highlight the presence of web feeds on the homepage and in taxonomy listings: &lt;link href=&#34;https://domain.example/index.xml&#34; rel=&#34;alternate&#34; type=&#34;application/rss+xml&#34; title=&#34;After Dark&#34;&gt; &lt;link href=&#34;https://domain.example/categories/privacy/index.xml&#34; rel=&#34;alternate&#34; type=&#34;application/rss+xml&#34; title=&#34;After Dark&#34;&gt; &lt;link href=&#34;https://domain.example/tags/color/index.xml&#34; rel=&#34;alternate&#34; type=&#34;application/rss+xml&#34; title=&#34;After Dark&#34;&gt; In addition to defaults After Dark recognizes the prev and next link types if specified in page Front Matter: prev = &#34;/series/learn-to-code/part-one/&#34; next = &#34;/series/learn-to-code/part-three/&#34; Use prev and next link types for segmented articles, Live Blog Postings or to mimic the traits of a series taxonomy if no series taxonomy is present. Link Types are commonly shown at the top of the page in text browsers such as ELinks as an auxiliary form of navigation and can help robots and users better understand relationships between your content. Learn more about link types and Taxonomies in Hugo.

item.title: Post Bylines
item.description: After Dark creates rich post bylines automatically. Bylines include optional author name, word count, links to Taxonomy Pages and Structured Data. Example Byline Published [by `author`] [`publishdate` or `date`] in [navigation](/categories/navigation) and tagged [links](/tags/links) and [taxonomy](/tags/taxonomy) using [`wordcount`] words. If author is specified in Site Configuration params or post Front Matter it will be included automatically in the byline attributing the author: [params] author = "Billy Joe Jim Bob" # the guy behind the guy behind the guy Adjust hide_author in Site Configuration to suppress attribution site-wide:
item.content:encoded: After Dark creates rich post bylines automatically. Bylines include optional author name, word count, links to Taxonomy Pages and Structured Data. Example Byline Published [by `author`] [`publishdate` or `date`] in [navigation](/categories/navigation) and tagged [links](/tags/links) and [taxonomy](/tags/taxonomy) using [`wordcount`] words. If author is specified in Site Configuration params or post Front Matter it will be included automatically in the byline attributing the author: [params] author = &#34;Billy Joe Jim Bob&#34; # the guy behind the guy behind the guy Adjust hide_author in Site Configuration to suppress attribution site-wide: [params] author = &#34;&#34; # optional setting, not required in config hide_author = true # hides author name and related structured data Combine with categories and Last Modified to produce unique Structured Data.

item.title: Section Menu
item.description: After Dark uses Hugo’s Section Menu for “Lazy” Bloggers to create a site-wide navigational aid. The section menu is disabled by default. Interactive Example Overview Features Modules Shortcodes Extras Search Enable it from menu.main layout config in your site configuration: [params.layout.menu.main] hidden = true # set `false` or remove to show section menu With the menu enabled navigation links will begin appearing automatically on a per-section basis whenever Published Content is available within that section.
item.content:encoded: After Dark uses Hugo&rsquo;s Section Menu for “Lazy” Bloggers to create a site-wide navigational aid. The section menu is disabled by default. Interactive Example Overview Features Modules Shortcodes Extras Search Enable it from menu.main layout config in your site configuration: [params.layout.menu.main] hidden = true # set `false` or remove to show section menu With the menu enabled navigation links will begin appearing automatically on a per-section basis whenever Published Content is available within that section. Customizing Adjust link names and menu positions by adding the following code block to your Site Configuration and modifying it to meet your needs: [[menu.main]] name = &#34;Home&#34; weight = 1 identifier = &#34;home&#34; url = &#34;/&#34; [[menu.main]] name = &#34;Posts&#34; weight = 2 identifier = &#34;post&#34; url = &#34;/post/&#34; Exclude menu items by identifier: [params.layout.menu.main] exclude = [&#34;home&#34;, &#34;post&#34;] # exclude homepage and blog postings Decorate links with SVG icons using pre and post: [[menu.main]] name = &#34;Search&#34; identifier = &#34;search&#34; url = &#34;/search/&#34; post = &#34;&lt;svg aria-hidden=\&#34;true\&#34; class=\&#34;i-search\&#34; viewBox=\&#34;0 0 32 32\&#34; width=\&#34;14\&#34; height=\&#34;14\&#34; fill=\&#34;none\&#34; stroke=\&#34;currentcolor\&#34; stroke-linecap=\&#34;round\&#34; stroke-linejoin=\&#34;round\&#34; stroke-width=\&#34;3\&#34;&gt;&lt;circle cx=\&#34;14\&#34; cy=\&#34;14\&#34; r=\&#34;12\&#34; /&gt;&lt;path d=\&#34;M23 23 L30 30\&#34; /&gt;&lt;/svg&gt;&#34; Link to stand-alone pages using Front Matter menu setting: title = &#34;About&#34; menu = &#34;main&#34; Change the link title to differentiate from page: title = &#34;About Us&#34; menu = &#34;main&#34; linktitle = &#34;About&#34; Position items using Menu Entry Variables for more control: title = &#34;About Us&#34; [menu.main] name = &#34;About&#34; weight = 5 Provide your own config settings for use in Custom Layouts: [params.layout.menu.main.custom] social_icons = [&#34;telegram&#34;, &#34;mastodon&#34;, &#34;matrix&#34;] And access them via your customized navmenu.html, if present: {{range.settings.custom.social_icons}} {{partial&#34;social-links.html&#34;.}} {{end}} Create a second menu immediately after the first: [[menu.main]] name = &#34;Posts&#34; weight = 2 identifier = &#34;post&#34; url = &#34;/post/&#34; [[menu.utility]] name = &#34;Email&#34; weight = 1 identifier = &#34;email&#34; url = &#34;mailto:d0x3d@posteo.com&#34; And position it to the right using Custom Styles: .hack &gt; header { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr minmax(min-content, auto); column-gap: 20px; grid-template-areas: &#34;nav nav&#34;; } See Menus in Hugo for additional capabilities. For help with CSS Grid Layout get your feet wet at cssgridgarden.com.

item.title: Taxonomy Pages
item.description: After Dark generates categorical and tag taxonomy and taxonomy terms pages and links to them automatically in posts using Post Bylines. Given the following page Front Matter for a post type: categories = ["navigation"] tags = ["links", "taxonomy"] The following taxonomy links would appear in the byline: Published [by author] [publishdate or date] in navigation and tagged links and taxonomy using [wordcount] words. item.content:encoded: After Dark generates categorical and tag taxonomy and taxonomy terms pages and links to them automatically in posts using Post Bylines. Given the following page Front Matter for a post type: categories = [&#34;navigation&#34;] tags = [&#34;links&#34;, &#34;taxonomy&#34;] The following taxonomy links would appear in the byline: Published [by author] [publishdate or date] in navigation and tagged links and taxonomy using [wordcount] words. The following Index Blocked taxonomy pages generated: /categories/index.html /categories/navigation/index.html /tags/index.html /tags/links/index.html /tags/taxonomy/index.html The following taxonomic web feeds created: /categories/index.xml /categories/navigation/index.xml /tags/index.xml /tags/links/index.xml /tags/taxonomy/index.xml The Sitemap and Related Content updated and, if activated, the Fuzzy Search JSON search index (weighted on taxonomy) regenerated, all automatically. See Taxonomies in Hugo to learn about taxonomies and how to customize them.
